node.title: Blur to play Øya Wednesday 7th of August
node.excerpt: One of the biggest British bands of the last 20 years will play Øya, marking their first live show in Norway in ten years. Blur are set to headline Øya Festival 2013 on Wednesday the 7th of august. We are extremely proud to have a band of this size and recognition confirmed so early. There […]

node.title: First acts confirmed for Øya 2013
node.excerpt: OF MONSTERS AND MEN (IS) TØNES REBEKKA KARIJORD ANGEL HAZE (US) GOAT (SE) MONICA HELDAL OKKULOKRATI The first acts for next year’s Øya Festival are now confirmed. The festival passes will be on sale on Thursday 29th of November, 9.00 a.m. at Billettservice. Tickets can be purchased online, at the post office, 7 Eleven or […]

node.title: The Bell Laboratory released on Rough Trade
node.excerpt: Pantha Du Prince & The Bell Laboratory, the Norwegian-German project which had its live debut at last year’s Øya Festival, will now release an album on Rough Trade Records, which is known to have released records by The Smiths, Throbbing Ghristle, The Strokes, Sufjan Stevens,  Antony & The Johnsons and many more. The two Norwegian […]

node.title: Thank you – see you next year
node.excerpt: Øya 2012 is just over. Through four eventful days in the Medieval Park and a huge amount of club shows, thousands of people enjoyed great music. The concerts have been well attended throughout the festival. Our audience really knows how to create a good atmosphere. The last two days we have also had some of […]

node.title: Frank Ocean cancels mid-show
node.excerpt: Unfortunately, Frank Ocean had to cancel his afternoon concert after just 15 minutes due to acute problems with his voice. We deeply apologise for the inconvenience this may have caused.

node.title: Sei A to play Klubben
node.excerpt: Factory Floor has cancelled their gig tonight   Sei A is playing instead. He will also play Øyanatt at Sukkerbiten Disclosure and Sei A at Sukkerbiten   Statement from Factory Floor: “Due to album recording commitments Factory Floor are unable to make appearances at Way Out West and Oya festivals this summer. We apologise to […]

node.title: Billy Bragg and Savages to play Øya
node.excerpt: We have gotten two cancellations just before the festival starts, and have been working hard to find good replacements. Savages and Billy Bragg comes to the Medieval Park to play on Thursday 9th of August. Both Haim and Here We Go Magic have unfortunately been forced to cancel their European gigs in August. We hope […]

node.title: A few day tickets for sale at the entrance
node.excerpt: There is one last chance to get day passes to this year’s Øya. A a small number of tickets will be on sale at the entrance to the festival from Wednesday to Saturday (only tickets for the same day). The price will be NOK 750, -. We hope this can be a small contribution to […]

node.title: Almost 90 club shows on tuesday 7th of august
node.excerpt: Klubbdagen (The Club Day) is the traditional opening day of Øya, with concerts at our favorite clubs around the city of Oslo. This evening you can experience a lot of fresh new talent. The gigs are included for anyone who has a full festival pass. This year’s edition of the Klubbdagen includes over 85 concerts […]

node.title: The Øya Festival is sold out – Jessie Ware plays Saturday
node.excerpt: Yesterday, the ticket office sold the last tickets to The Øya Festival 2012. This means we sold out in record time. 15,000 people are looking forward to each of the four days in the Medieval Park, and a lot of club shows during the festival week. We cannot wait to get started about six weeks. […]
